output.conclusion: This course has provided a foundational understanding of physiotherapy principles and practices. Further study and practical experience are essential for developing proficiency in this field.
output.introduction: Welcome to Physiotherapy Fundamentals! This course will introduce you to the core concepts and principles of physiotherapy, providing a solid foundation for further learning and practice.

chapters.description: Overview of physiotherapy: definition, scope of practice, and historical context. The role of a physiotherapist in healthcare.
Ethical principles in physiotherapy practice: patient autonomy, beneficence, non-maleficence, and justice. Professional conduct and responsibilities.
Understanding the importance of patient-centered care. Building rapport and effective communication skills.
Review of basic human anatomy: skeletal system, muscular system, and nervous system. Introduction to physiological processes relevant to movement.
Introduction to biomechanical principles: levers, forces, and motion. Understanding how these principles apply to human movement.
Understanding posture and its importance. Principles of proper body mechanics for therapists and patients.
Overview of the physiotherapy assessment process: subjective examination, objective examination, and evaluation.
Developing skills in observation and palpation. Identifying key anatomical landmarks and movement patterns.
Introduction to range of motion (ROM) testing: goniometry and visual estimation. Normal ROM values for major joints.
Overview of therapeutic exercise: goals, principles, and types of exercises. Importance of exercise prescription.
Introduction to different stretching techniques: static, dynamic, and PNF. Indications and contraindications for stretching.
Introduction to strengthening exercises: isometric, isotonic, and isokinetic. Proper form and progression.
Understanding pain mechanisms: nociception, pain pathways, and pain modulation. Introduction to pain assessment tools.
Introduction to common physiotherapy modalities: heat, cold, and TENS. Indications and contraindications for each modality.
Introduction to manual therapy techniques: massage, mobilization, and manipulation. Safety considerations and ethical practice.
